title: Remove PDF column from application status display

requirements.summary: Remove the PDF attachment column/section from the ApplicationStatusManager component display while preserving the underlying PDF storage functionality in the backend
acceptanceCriteria: The PDF column is no longer visible in the application status table/list
Users cannot see or download PDF attachments from the UI
PDF data continues to be stored in the backend when creating/editing status entries
The PdfAttachmentSection component is not rendered
No PDF-related UI elements appear in the ApplicationStatusManager component

file_operations.description: Remove all PDF-related UI elements from the ApplicationStatusManager component including: (1) Remove the PdfAttachmentSection component rendering from the status display table/cards, (2) Remove PDF upload input fields from the create/edit forms, (3) Remove all PDF download/view buttons and links, (4) Keep the backend PDF storage logic intact by maintaining the attachment field in status objects when calling createOrUpdateApplicationStatus, (5) Remove PDF file state management from the component (useState for PDF files), (6) Remove PDF-related form handlers and validation, (7) Ensure the component continues to function normally for all other fields (status, applicant name, email, visa type, comments)

Remove all PDF-related UI elements from the AustralianVisaCheckPage component including: (1) Remove the PdfAttachmentSection component rendering from the status check results display, (2) Remove any PDF attachment indicators or links in the results card, (3) Keep the backend query logic intact to continue fetching full status data including attachments, (4) Ensure the page displays all other application status fields normally (application ID, status, visa type, applicant name, email, last updated, comments)
